intro: Espeletia schultzii var. schultzii, commonly known as the Schultze's espeletia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean highlands of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is often found in cloud forests and páramo ecosystems.
